form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: INSTRUCTIONS FOR FORM N-648 MEDICAL CERTIFICATION FOR DISABILITY EXCEPTIONS

full_text: INSTRUCTIONS FOR FORM N-648 MEDICAL CERTIFICATION FOR DISABILITY EXCEPTIONS Purpose of This Form. The Immigration and Naturalization Service's (INS) regulations require that applicants seeking exception from the English and U.S. history and government (civics) requirements naturalization based on physical or developmental disability or mental impairment submit certification form, completed by a licensed medical doctor or a licensed clinical psycholo along with a completed application for naturalization (Form N-400). This certification form be used by the INS to determine whether applicants for naturalization are entitled to an excep to the requirements. In accordance with the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, INS makes reasonable modifications an accommodations to allow individuals with disabilities to participate in testing required naturalization. Reasonable modifications and/or accommodations may include but are not lim to: Braille test forms, sign language interpreters, or off-site testing. Applicants should be adv that if reasonable modifications and/or accommodations will allow them to demonst knowledge of basic English and U.S. history and civics, this medical certification form is required. Part I of the form must be completed and signed by the applicant. The form also contains acknowledged release by the applicant of his or her medical records to include both physical mental health. Part II of the form must be completed and signed by the licensed medical do or licensed clinical psychologist performing the assessment of the applicant. The licensed mec doctor or licensed clinical psychologist is required to attest to the truthfulness of his or certification under penalty of perjury and agree to release his or her medical records relatin the applicant upon request by the INS. General Instructions. Please answer all questions by typing or printing clearly in black ink. Indicate that an item is applicable with "N/A". If an answer is "none," write "none". If you need extra space to ans any item, attach a sheet of paper with the name of the applicant, and the alien registra number (A#), and your complete name including first name, middle name and last name, appropriate title. Also, indicate the number of the item to which the answer refers. Additional medical reports may be submitted but they must be limited to not more than pages, and have the name of the applicant, alien registration number and your signa on each page of the attachments. Additional medical records may be submitted but will no accepted as a substitute for complete responses to questions asked on the certification form. 1. You are requested to provide an accurate assessment of the applicant's disability impairment so the INS can determine whether to grant an exception to the English language history and civics requirements for naturalization. 2. The INS requires that the licensed medical doctor or licensed clinical psychologist comple the form for the applicant be experienced in the area of the applicant's disability, and abl diagnose the applicant's disability and/or impairments. A certification must be made as whether the applicant has the ability to learn English and civics sufficient to pass the I citizenship test. The tests require an ability to speak and write basic English and the abiliti answer basic questions about the history and civics of the United States.
